testCaseDescription: Validate repository visibility settings during and after creation

testSteps.Step_Desc: 1. Login to GitHub with valid credentials. [Test Data- Email: valid@email.com, Password: validPassword] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
testSteps.Expected_Result: 1. User is logged in and dashboard is displayed.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 2. Click 'New Repository' button. [Test Data- N/A] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]

3. Enter valid repository name and description. Select 'Public' visibility. [Test Data- Repository Name: 'public-repo', Description: 'Test public repo', Visibility: Public] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
testSteps.Expected_Result: 3. Details are accepted and 'Public' is selected.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 4. Click 'Create Repository'. [Test Data- N/A] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
testSteps.Expected_Result: 4. Repository is created and displayed in repository list.

testSteps.Step_Desc: 5. Verify that the created repository is marked as 'Public' in its settings and UI. [Test Data- Repository Name: 'public-repo'] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
6. Repeat steps 2-5 for 'Private' visibility. [Test Data- Repository Name: 'private-repo', Description: 'Test private repo', Visibility: Private] [Acceptance Criteria- AC-2, bullet 5]
